intro: Tripolium vulgare var. longicaule, commonly known as the long-stemmed thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands. Its stems are often branched and have a rough texture, while its leaves are lance-shaped and have a strong scent. The flowers bloom in umbels, contributing to its role in supporting pollinators.
